78
SPECIFYING AN HEIR
(1) A testator may specify one or more heirs in a will.
(2) A testamentary heir is the heir specified by the testator to inherit all of his or her property or a certain portion of the whole.
(3) An heir shall also be a person to whom the testator in his or her will left one or more specified items of property or rights, when it is determined that it was the testator's will that this person be his or her heir.
